004
005package edu.wpi.first.hal;
006
007/**
008 * A wrapper around a simulator device handle.
009 *
010 * <p>Teams: if you are using this class, you are likely confusing it for {@link
011 * edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.simulation.SimDeviceSim}.
012 *
013 * <p>Vendors: This class should be used from inside the device class to define the
014 * properties/fields of the device. Use {@link #create} to get a SimDevice object, then use {@link
015 * #createDouble(String, Direction, double)} or similar to define the device's fields. See {@link
016 * edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.ADXRS450_Gyro} for an example implementation.
017 */
018public class SimDevice implements AutoCloseable {
019  public enum Direction {
020    kInput(SimDeviceJNI.kInput),
021    kOutput(SimDeviceJNI.kOutput),
022    kBidir(SimDeviceJNI.kBidir);
023
024    public final int m_value;
025
026    Direction(int value) {
027      m_value = value;
028    }
029  }
030
031  /**
032   * Creates a simulated device.
033   *
034   * <p>The device name must be unique. Returns null if the device name already exists. If multiple
035   * instances of the same device are desired, recommend appending the instance/unique identifer in
036   * brackets to the base name, e.g. "device[1]".
037   *
038   * <p>null is returned if not in simulation.
039   *
040   * @param name device name
041   * @return simulated device object
042   */
043  public static SimDevice create(String name) {
044    int handle = SimDeviceJNI.createSimDevice(name);
045    if (handle <= 0) {
046      return null;
047    }
048    return new SimDevice(handle);
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * Creates a simulated device.
053   *
054   * <p>The device name must be unique. Returns null if the device name already exists. This is a
055   * convenience method that appends index in brackets to the device name, e.g. passing index=1
056   * results in "device[1]" for the device name.
057   *
058   * <p>null is returned if not in simulation.
059   *
060   * @param name device name
061   * @param index device index number to append to name
062   * @return simulated device object
063   */
064  public static SimDevice create(String name, int index) {
065    return create(name + "[" + index + "]");
066  }
067
068  /**
069   * Creates a simulated device.
070   *
071   * <p>The device name must be unique. Returns null if the device name already exists. This is a
072   * convenience method that appends index and channel in brackets to the device name, e.g. passing
073   * index=1 and channel=2 results in "device[1,2]" for the device name.
074   *
075   * <p>null is returned if not in simulation.
076   *
077   * @param name device name
078   * @param index device index number to append to name
079   * @param channel device channel number to append to name
080   * @return simulated device object
081   */
082  public static SimDevice create(String name, int index, int channel) {
083    return create(name + "[" + index + "," + channel + "]");
084  }
085
086  /**
087   * Wraps a simulated device handle as returned by SimDeviceJNI.createSimDevice().
088   *
089   * @param handle simulated device handle
090   */
091  public SimDevice(int handle) {
092    m_handle = handle;
093  }
094
095  @Override
096  public void close() {
097    SimDeviceJNI.freeSimDevice(m_handle);
098  }
099
100  /**
101   * Get the internal device handle.
102   *
103   * @return internal handle
104   */
105  public int getNativeHandle() {
106    return m_handle;
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Creates a value on the simulated device.
111   *
112   * <p>Returns null if not in simulation.
113   *
114   * @param name value name
115   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
116   * @param initialValue initial value
117   * @return simulated value object
118   */
119  public SimValue createValue(String name, Direction direction, HALValue initialValue) {
120    int handle = SimDeviceJNI.createSimValue(m_handle, name, direction.m_value, initialValue);
121    if (handle <= 0) {
122      return null;
123    }
124    return new SimValue(handle);
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Creates an int value on the simulated device.
129   *
130   * <p>Returns null if not in simulation.
131   *
132   * @param name value name
133   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
134   * @param initialValue initial value
135   * @return simulated double value object
136   */
137  public SimInt createInt(String name, Direction direction, int initialValue) {
138    int handle = SimDeviceJNI.createSimValueInt(m_handle, name, direction.m_value, initialValue);
139    if (handle <= 0) {
140      return null;
141    }
142    return new SimInt(handle);
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Creates a long value on the simulated device.
147   *
148   * <p>Returns null if not in simulation.
149   *
150   * @param name value name
151   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
152   * @param initialValue initial value
153   * @return simulated double value object
154   */
155  public SimLong createLong(String name, Direction direction, long initialValue) {
156    int handle = SimDeviceJNI.createSimValueLong(m_handle, name, direction.m_value, initialValue);
157    if (handle <= 0) {
158      return null;
159    }
160    return new SimLong(handle);
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Creates a double value on the simulated device.
165   *
166   * <p>Returns null if not in simulation.
167   *
168   * @param name value name
169   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
170   * @param initialValue initial value
171   * @return simulated double value object
172   */
173  public SimDouble createDouble(String name, Direction direction, double initialValue) {
174    int handle = SimDeviceJNI.createSimValueDouble(m_handle, name, direction.m_value, initialValue);
175    if (handle <= 0) {
176      return null;
177    }
178    return new SimDouble(handle);
179  }
180
181  /**
182   * Creates an enumerated value on the simulated device.
183   *
184   * <p>Enumerated values are always in the range 0 to numOptions-1.
185   *
186   * <p>Returns null if not in simulation.
187   *
188   * @param name value name
189   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
190   * @param options array of option descriptions
191   * @param initialValue initial value (selection)
192   * @return simulated enum value object
193   */
194  public SimEnum createEnum(String name, Direction direction, String[] options, int initialValue) {
195    int handle =
196        SimDeviceJNI.createSimValueEnum(m_handle, name, direction.m_value, options, initialValue);
197    if (handle <= 0) {
198      return null;
199    }
200    return new SimEnum(handle);
201  }
202
203  /**
204   * Creates an enumerated value on the simulated device with double values.
205   *
206   * <p>Enumerated values are always in the range 0 to numOptions-1.
207   *
208   * <p>Returns null if not in simulation.
209   *
210   * @param name value name
211   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
212   * @param options array of option descriptions
213   * @param optionValues array of option values (must be the same size as options)
214   * @param initialValue initial value (selection)
215   * @return simulated enum value object
216   */
217  public SimEnum createEnumDouble(
218      String name, Direction direction, String[] options, double[] optionValues, int initialValue) {
219    int handle =
220        SimDeviceJNI.createSimValueEnumDouble(
221            m_handle, name, direction.m_value, options, optionValues, initialValue);
222    if (handle <= 0) {
223      return null;
224    }
225    return new SimEnum(handle);
226  }
227
228  /**
229   * Creates a boolean value on the simulated device.
230   *
231   * <p>Returns null if not in simulation.
232   *
233   * @param name value name
234   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
235   * @param initialValue initial value
236   * @return simulated boolean value object
237   */
238  public SimBoolean createBoolean(String name, Direction direction, boolean initialValue) {
239    int handle =
240        SimDeviceJNI.createSimValueBoolean(m_handle, name, direction.m_value, initialValue);
241    if (handle <= 0) {
242      return null;
243    }
244    return new SimBoolean(handle);
245  }
246
247  private final int m_handle;
248}
